title: The Stronghold

thumbnail.alt_text: A work made of oil on canvas.

publication_history:
International Exhibition of Modern Art, exh. cat. (Association of American Painters and Sculptors, Inc., 1913), n.p., cat. 463.

International Exhibition of Modern Art, 2nd ed., exh. cat. (Association of American Painters and Sculptors, Inc., 1913), n.p., cat. 382.

Arthur Jerome Eddy, Cubists and Post-Impressionism (A. C. McClurg, 1914), p. 85.

Exhibition of Paintings from the Collection of the Late Arthur Jerome Eddy, exh. cat. (Art Institute of Chicago, 1922), n.p., cat. 15.

Exhibition of the Arthur Jerome Eddy Collection of Modern Paintings and Sculpture, exh. cat. (Art Institute of Chicago, 1931), p. 24, cat. 17.

A Guide to the Paintings in the Permanent Collection (Art Institute of Chicago, 1932), p. 172.

C. J. Bulliet, “The Eddy Gift to Chicago,” Creative Art 10 (March 1932), p. 216.

José-Augusto Franca, Amadeo de Souza Cardoso (Sul, 1956), pp. 61; 63, cat. 9 (as Fortaleza); n.p. (ill.).

“A exposição de Amadeo de Souza-Cardoso,” Jornal de Notícias, May 11, 1956.

Paintings in The Art Institute of Chicago: A Catalogue of the Picture Collection (Art Institute of Chicago, 1961), p. 421.

Milton W. Brown, The Story of the Armory Show (New York Graphic Society, 1963), pp. 100; 292, cat. 463; n.p. (ill.).

Munson-Williams-Proctor Institute, 1913 Armory Show—50th Anniversary Exhibition, exh. cat. (Munson-Williams-Proctor Institute, 1963), pp. 81 (ill.); 205, cat. 463.

Paris—New York, exh. cat. (Centre national d’art et de culture Georges Pompidou, 1977), p. 719.

Helen Lefkowitz Horowitz, “The Art Institute of Chicago: The First Forty Years/2,” Chicago History: The Magazine of the Chicago Historical Society VIII, no. 1 (Spring 1979), p. 12 (color ill.).

A. James Speyer and Courtney Graham Donnell, Twentieth-Century European Paintings (Chicago, 1980), p. 71, cat. 4A5 (microfiche ill.).

Amadeo de Souza-Cardoso: A Primeira Descoberta de Portugal: Na Europa no Século XX, exh. cat. (Fundação Calouste Gulbenkian, 1983), n.p. (ill., as Chateau fort).

José-Augusto França, Amadeo de Souza-Cardoso: o português à força & Almada Negreiros: o português sem mestre (Bertrand, 1986), p. 35.

Paul Kruty, “Arthur Jerome Eddy and his Collection: Prelude and Postscript to the Armory Show,” Arts Magazine 61, no. 6 (February 1987), pp. 43, 46n34.

Eurico Gonçalves, “Amadeo de Souza-Cardoso (1887-1918): O primeiro pintor moderno português,” Cultura, Diário de Notícias, May 6, 1993, pp.10-11.

Paulo Ferreira, Amadeo de Souza Cardoso: Peintre Portugais, 1887–1918 (Fundação Calouste Gulkenkian, 1995), pp. 99, 133.

Laurette E. McCarthy, “Walter Pach: Artist, Critic, Historian, and Agent of Modernism,” Ph.D. dissertation, University of Delaware, 1996, pp. 114, 126n58.

Amadeo de Souza Cardoso, exh. cat. (Fundación Juan March, 1998), p. 79.

The Corcoran Gallery of Art, At the Edge: A Portuguese Futurist, Amadeo de Souza Cardoso, exh. cat. (Washington D. C.: The Corcoran Gallery of Art, 1999), pp. 32; 83; 91; 92; 125 (ill.); 191, cat. 10.

Robert J. Loescher, “A Neglected Modernist,” Art in America 88, no. 9 (September 2000), p. 139.

Mondrian/Amadeo: da paisagem à abstracção/from landscape to abstraction, exh. cat. (Museu de Arte Contemporânea de Serralves, 2001), p. 103.

Centro de Arte Moderna José de Azeredo Perdigão, Fundação Calouste Gulbenkian, Amadeo de Souza Cardoso: Diálogo de Vanguardas/Avant-Garde Dialogues (Centro de Arte Moderna José de Azeredo Perdigão, Fundação Calouste Gulbenkian, 2006), pp. 15; 16; 35; 36; 41; 42; 341, cat. 10; 369; 370; 381; 382; 402; 403; 459; 460; 495 (ill.); n.p. (color ill.).

Helena de Freitas, ed., Catálogo Raisonné: Amadeo de Souza Cardoso (Fundação Calouste Gulbenkian; Assírio & Alvim, 2008), pp. 165-67, cat. P30 (color ill.).

Helena de Freitas, ed., Catálogo Raisonné: Amadeo de Souza Cardoso, 2nd ed. (Fundação   Calouste Gulbenkian, 2016), pp. 165-67, cat. P30 (color ill.).
exhibition_history:
New York, International Exhibition of Modern Art, Feb. 17–Mar. 15, 1913, cat. 463 (as Chateau fort); Art Institute of Chicago, Mar. 24–Apr. 16, 1913 (cat. 382).

Art Institute of Chicago, Exhibition of Paintings from the Collection of the Late Arthur Jerome Eddy, Sept. 19–Oct. 22, 1922, cat. 15.

Art Institute of Chicago, Exhibition of the Arthur Jerome Eddy Collection of Modern Paintings and Sculpture, Dec. 22, 1931–Jan. 17, 1932, cat. 17.

Utica, N.Y., Munson-Williams-Proctor Institute, 1913 Armory Show—50th Anniversary Exhibition 1963, Feb. 17–Mar. 31, 1963, cat. 463; New York, Armory of the 69th Regiment, Apr. 6–28, 1963.

Washington D. C., Corcoran Gallery of Art, At the Edge: A Portuguese Futurist, Amadeo de Souza Cardoso, Sept. 11–Nov. 28, 1999, cat. 10; Arts Club of Chicago, Jan. 20–Mar. 17, 2000.

Lisbon, Centro de Arte Moderna José de Azeredo Perdigão, Fundação Calouste Gulbenkian, Amadeo de Souza Cardoso: Diálogo de Vanguardas/Avant-Garde Dialogues, Nov. 15, 2006–Jan.14, 2007, cat. 10.

New York Historical Society, The Armory Show at 100, Oct. 11, 2013–Feb. 23, 2014.

Paris, Galeries nationales d'exposition du Grand Palais, Paris, Amadeo de Souza Cardoso, Apr. 20–July 18, 2016.
provenance_text: The artist; sold through Walter Pach, New York, to Arthur Jerome Eddy (1859-1920), Chicago, Apr. 10, 1913 [letter to the artist, May 2, 1913, Walter Kuhn papers, Archives of American Art, Smithsonian Institution, copy in curatorial object file; McCarthy 1996; Washington 1999]; by descent to his wife Lucy O. Eddy (1863-1931) and son Jerome O. Eddy (1891-1951), Chicago, 1920; given to the Art Institute of Chicago, 1931.
